title: Facebook's political ad ban is going to continue for at least a month

title: Ignore the Political Noise and Ride Facebook Stock to $350+

title: Facebook plans to continue a ban on political ads for another month.
text: The social network told advertisers about its timeline in an update on Wednesday.

title: Facebook, Google face criticism over political-ad bans ahead of Senate runoffs in Georgia
text: The Democratic Senatorial Campaign Committee called the ad bans "voter suppression." Facebook says the ad ban is temporary and helps safeguard US elections.

title: Facebook extends ban on US political ads for another month
text: As election misinformation continued to rage online, Facebook said Wednesday its post-election ban on political ads would likely last another month, raising concerns from campaigns and groups eager to reach voters for key Georgia Senate races in January. Facebook, which had announced the ban as part of measures to combat misinformation and other abuses on.

title: Facebook extends its temporary ban on political ads for another month
text: The election is settled, but the nation is far from it. Before Election Day in the U.S., Facebook hit pause on all political and social issue ads.

title: Facebook's Ban On Political Ads Will Continue For One More Month
text: The company stopped displaying political ads after polls closed on November 3.

title: Facebook tells advertisers that pause on political ads expected to last another month
text: Facebook said there might be an opportunity to resume ads sooner.
